content.description: Excellent climb with an exciting start and good slab climbing after.  When first approaching this climb it appears as if the first bolt isn't reachable until after the first move onto the main face of the climb. When you get to the base of the climb (large boulder) you can reach the first bolt by leaning across from the boulder that you start the climb from.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a bolted anchor with rings
content.location: Just before you can circle around to the south side of Conrad rock you'll see the climb.  You have to scramble up on to a large boulder to start the climb, this can be done by tunneling under it and then climbing up or from passing the large boulder and scrambling up from the south.

content.description: Face climbing up rock with sharp crystals.  Some grainy rock exists but if you follow the bolt path it's reasonably clean.  Good holds around the corner of the arete.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a bolted anchor with rings
content.location: Follow the directions to Conrad Rock (W. Face).  Scramble up some boulders reach the base of the climb.
